docs.snippet: One man was killed and four firefighters received minor injuries in an apartment fire on the 50th floor of Trump Tower in New York on Saturday, in a blaze that was quickly extinguished, fire officials said.

headline.main: One Killed in Apartment Fire at Trump Tower in New York
headline.print_headline: One Killed in Apartment Fire at Trump Tower in New York

docs.snippet: A woman is claiming in a lawsuit that a house that was turned into a shrine to then-presidential candidate Donald Trump played a part in a car accident in which she was severely injured.

headline.main: Woman Blames Owner of 'Trump House' Shrine for Car Crash
headline.print_headline: Woman Blames Owner of 'Trump House' Shrine for Car Crash

docs.snippet: An Indiana Senate candidate who carries a cardboard cutout of Donald Trump to campaign rallies, dons a "Make America Great Again" hat in a TV ad and ridicules an opponent for being a "Never Trumper" called the eventual president "vulgar, if not pr...

headline.main: Indiana GOP Senate Candidate Called Trump 'Vulgar' in 2016
headline.print_headline: Indiana GOP Senate Candidate Called Trump 'Vulgar' in 2016

docs.snippet: In his first public comments about Stormy Daniels, President Donald Trump said he didn't know about the $130,000 payment his personal attorney had made to the porn actress who alleges she had an affair with him.

headline.main: Did Trump Know About Payment to Stormy Daniels? He Says No
headline.print_headline: Did Trump Know About Payment to Stormy Daniels? He Says No

docs.snippet: Longtime Trump confidant Roger Stone has agreed to provide documents to the Senate Judiciary Committee — even though he says the request is "approaching absurd."

headline.main: Trump Ally Roger Stone Agrees to Share Docs With Senate
headline.print_headline: Trump Ally Roger Stone Agrees to Share Docs With Senate

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump was having it both ways over the past week, portraying a "crisis" at the Mexico border that demands the use of National Guard troops while boasting of a huge drop in illegal border crossings there.

headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Is Having It Both Ways on Border Policy
headline.print_headline: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Is Having It Both Ways on Border Policy

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump signed a memorandum on Friday ordering the end of a policy, known as "catch and release," in which illegal immigrants are released from detention while awaiting a court hearing on their status.

headline.main: Trump Signs Memo Ending 'Catch and Release' Immigration Policy
headline.print_headline: Trump Signs Memo Ending 'Catch and Release' Immigration Policy

docs.snippet: The Trump administration's recent trade actions toward China were not intended to punish any industries or the markets, but Beijing should shoulder the blame for any hit to the U.S. economy, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Thursd...

headline.main: Trump Adviser: Trade Moves Not Intended to Hurt U.S. Sectors
headline.print_headline: Trump Adviser: Trade Moves Not Intended to Hurt U.S. Sectors

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump on Thursday indicated he continued to back Environmental Protection Agency head Scott Pruitt, who is under fire for paying low rent on a condo owned by a lobbyist.

headline.main: Trump Says Still Has Confidence in Environmental Agency Head Pruitt
headline.print_headline: Trump Says Still Has Confidence in Environmental Agency Head Pruitt

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump, who has feuded with several media personalities and organizations, will not attend the White House Correspondents' Association annual black-tie dinner for the second straight year, the president of the group said on Fr...

headline.main: Trump to Snub White House Press Dinner for Second Consecutive Year
headline.print_headline: Trump to Snub White House Press Dinner for Second Consecutive Year
